db:abstract.db:para: The QLoggingCategory class represents a category, or 'area' in the logging infrastructure.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QLoggingCategory represents a certain logging category - identified by a string - at runtime. A category can be configured to enable or disable logging of messages per message type. Whether a message type is enabled or not can be checked with the isDebugEnabled(), isInfoEnabled(), isWarningEnabled(), and isCriticalEnabled() methods.

All objects are meant to be configured by a common registry (see also Configuring Categories). Different objects can also represent the same category. It is therefore not recommended to export objects across module boundaries, nor to manipulate the objects directly, nor to inherit from QLoggingCategory.

db:section.db:title: Creating Category Objects
db:section.db:para: The Q_DECLARE_LOGGING_CATEGORY() and Q_LOGGING_CATEGORY() macros conveniently declare and create QLoggingCategory objects:

db:note.db:para: Category names are free text. However, to allow easy configuration of the categories using Logging Rules the names should follow some rules:

db:listitem.db:para: Further structure categories into common areas by using dots.
Avoid the category names debug, info, warning, and critical.
Category names starting with qt are reserved for Qt modules.

db:section.db:title: Checking Category Configuration
db:section.db:para: QLoggingCategory provides isDebugEnabled(), isInfoEnabled(), isWarningEnabled(), isCriticalEnabled(), as well as isEnabled() to check whether messages for the given message type should be logged.

db:note.db:para: The qCDebug(), qCWarning(), qCCritical() macros prevent arguments from being evaluated if the respective message types are not enabled for the category, so explicit checking is not needed:

db:section.db:programlisting: // usbEntries() will only be called if driverUsb category is enabled qCDebug(driverUsb) << "devices: " << usbEntries();

db:section.db:title: Default Category Configuration
db:section.db:para: Both the QLoggingCategory constructor and the Q_LOGGING_CATEGORY() macro accept an optional QtMsgType argument, which disables all message types with a lower severity. That is, a category declared with
will log messages of type QtWarningMsg, QtCriticalMsg, QtFatalMsg, but will ignore messages of type QtDebugMsg and QtInfoMsg.
If no argument is passed, all messages will be logged.

db:section.db:title: Configuring Categories
db:section.db:para: The default configuration of categories can be overridden either by setting logging rules, or by installing a custom filter.

db:section.db:title: Logging Rules
db:section.db:para: Logging rules allow logging for categories to be enabled or disabled in a flexible way. Rules are specified in text, where every line must have the format

<category> is the name of the category, potentially with * as a wildcard symbol as the first or last character (or at both positions). The optional <type> must be either debug, info, warning, or critical. Lines that do not fit this scheme are ignored.
Rules are evaluated in text order, from first to last. That is, if two rules apply to a category/type, the rule that comes later is applied.

Rules can be set via setFilterRules(). Since Qt 5.3, logging rules can also be set in the QT_LOGGING_RULES environment variable, and are automatically loaded from the [Rules] section of a logging configuration file. Such configuration files are looked up in the QtProject configuration directory, or explicitly set in a QT_LOGGING_CONF environment variable:

Rules set by setFilterRules() take precedence over rules specified in the QtProject configuration directory, and can, in turn, be overwritten by rules from the configuration file specified by QT_LOGGING_CONF, and rules set by QT_LOGGING_RULES.
Since Qt 5.6, QT_LOGGING_RULES may contain multiple rules separated by semicolons:
Order of evaluation:
The QtProject/qtlogging.ini file is looked up in all directories returned by QStandardPaths::GenericConfigLocation, e.g.
Set the QT_LOGGING_DEBUG environment variable to see from where logging rules are loaded.

db:section.db:title: Installing a Custom Filter
db:section.db:para: As a lower-level alternative to the text rules, you can also implement a custom filter via installFilter(). All filter rules are ignored in this case.

db:section.db:title: Printing the Category
db:section.db:para: Use the %{category} placeholder to print the category in the default message handler:

db:section.db:title: QLoggingCategory::CategoryFilter
db:section.db:para: This is a typedef for a pointer to a function with the following signature:
A function with this signature can be installed with installFilter().

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QLoggingCategory::QLoggingCategory(const char *category)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QLoggingCategory object with the provided category name. All message types for this category are enabled by default.
If category is 0, the category name is changed to "default".

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] QLoggingCategory::QLoggingCategory(const char *category, QtMsgType enableForLevel)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QLoggingCategory object with the provided category name, and enables all messages with types more severe or equal than enableForLevel.
If category is 0, the category name is changed to "default".
This function was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QLoggingCategory::~QLoggingCategory()
db:section.db:para: Destructs a QLoggingCategory object.

db:section.db:title: const char *QLoggingCategory::categoryName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the category.

db:section.db:title: [static] QLoggingCategory *QLoggingCategory::defaultCategory()
db:section.db:para: Returns a pointer to the global category "default" that is used e.g. by qDebug(), qInfo(), qWarning(), qCritical(), qFatal().

db:note.db:para: The returned pointer may be null during destruction of static objects.
Ownership of the category is not transferred, do not delete the returned pointer.

db:section.db:title: [static] QLoggingCategory::CategoryFilter QLoggingCategory::installFilter(QLoggingCategory::CategoryFilter filter)
db:section.db:para: Installs a function filter that is used to determine which categories and message types should be enabled. Returns a pointer to the previous installed filter.
Every QLoggingCategory object created is passed to the filter, and the filter is free to change the respective category configuration with setEnabled().
The filter might be called concurrently from different threads, and therefore has to be reentrant.
Example:
An alternative way of configuring the default filter is via setFilterRules().

db:section.db:title: bool QLoggingCategory::isCriticalEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if critical messages should be shown for this category. Returns false otherwise.

db:note.db:para: The qCCritical() macro already does this check before executing any code. However, calling this method may be useful to avoid expensive generation of data that is only used for debug output.

db:section.db:title: bool QLoggingCategory::isDebugEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if debug messages should be shown for this category. Returns false otherwise.

db:note.db:para: The qCDebug() macro already does this check before executing any code. However, calling this method may be useful to avoid expensive generation of data that is only used for debug output.

db:section.db:title: bool QLoggingCategory::isEnabled(QtMsgType msgtype) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if a message of type msgtype for the category should be shown. Returns false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] bool QLoggingCategory::isInfoEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if informational messages should be shown for this category. Returns false otherwise.

db:note.db:para: The qCInfo() macro already does this check before executing any code. However, calling this method may be useful to avoid expensive generation of data that is only used for debug output.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: bool QLoggingCategory::isWarningEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if warning messages should be shown for this category. Returns false otherwise.

db:note.db:para: The qCWarning() macro already does this check before executing any code. However, calling this method may be useful to avoid expensive generation of data that is only used for debug output.

db:section.db:title: void QLoggingCategory::setEnabled(QtMsgType type, bool enable)
db:section.db:para: Changes the message type type for the category to enable.

db:note.db:para: Changes only affect the current QLoggingCategory object, and won't change the settings of other objects for the same category name. Use either setFilterRules() or installFilter() to change the configuration globally.
QtFatalMsg cannot be changed. It will always return true.

db:section.db:title: [static] void QLoggingCategory::setFilterRules(const QString &rules)
db:section.db:para: Configures which categories and message types should be enabled through a a set of rules.
Example:

db:note.db:para: The rules might be ignored if a custom category filter is installed with installFilter(), or if the user defined QT_LOGGING_CONF or QT_LOGGING_RULES environment variable.

db:section.db:title: QLoggingCategory &QLoggingCategory::operator()()
db:section.db:para: Returns the object itself. This allows both a QLoggingCategory variable, and a factory method returning a QLoggingCategory, to be used in qCDebug(), qCWarning(), qCCritical() macros.

db:section.db:title: const QLoggingCategory &QLoggingCategory::operator()() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the object itself. This allows both a QLoggingCategory variable, and a factory method returning a QLoggingCategory, to be used in qCDebug(), qCWarning(), qCCritical() macros.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] Q_DECLARE_LOGGING_CATEGORY(name)
db:section.db:para: Declares a logging category name. The macro can be used to declare a common logging category shared in different parts of the program.
This macro must be used outside of a class or method.
This macro was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] Q_LOGGING_CATEGORY(name, string)
db:section.db:para: Defines a logging category name, and makes it configurable under the string identifier. By default, all message types are enabled.
Only one translation unit in a library or executable can define a category with a specific name.
This macro must be used outside of a class or method.
This macro was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] Q_LOGGING_CATEGORY(name, string, msgType)
db:section.db:para: Defines a logging category name, and makes it configurable under the string identifier. By default, messages of QtMsgType msgType and more severe are enabled, types with a lower severity are disabled.
Only one translation unit in a library or executable can define a category with a specific name.
This macro must be used outside of a class or method. It is only defined if variadic macros are supported.
This macro was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] qCCritical(category)
db:section.db:para: Returns an output stream for critical messages in the logging category category.
The macro expands to code that checks whether QLoggingCategory::isCriticalEnabled() evaluates to true. If so, the stream arguments are processed and sent to the message handler.
Example:

db:note.db:para: Arguments are not processed if critical output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] qCCritical(category, const char *message, ...)
db:section.db:para: Logs a critical message message in the logging category category. message might contain place holders that are replaced by additional arguments, similar to the C printf() function.
Example:
db:section.db:programlisting: QLoggingCategory category("driver.usb"); qCCritical(category, "a critical message logged into category %s", category.categoryName());

db:note.db:para: Arguments might not be processed if critical output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] qCDebug(category)
db:section.db:para: Returns an output stream for debug messages in the logging category category.
The macro expands to code that checks whether QLoggingCategory::isDebugEnabled() evaluates to true. If so, the stream arguments are processed and sent to the message handler.
Example:

db:note.db:para: Arguments are not processed if debug output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] qCDebug(category, const char *message, ...)
db:section.db:para: Logs a debug message message in the logging category category. message might contain place holders that are replaced by additional arguments, similar to the C printf() function.
Example:
db:section.db:programlisting: QLoggingCategory category("driver.usb"); qCDebug(category, "a debug message logged into category %s", category.categoryName());

db:note.db:para: Arguments might not be processed if debug output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] qCInfo(category)
db:section.db:para: Returns an output stream for informational messages in the logging category category.
The macro expands to code that checks whether QLoggingCategory::isInfoEnabled() evaluates to true. If so, the stream arguments are processed and sent to the message handler.
Example:

db:note.db:para: Arguments are not processed if debug output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] qCInfo(category, const char *message, ...)
db:section.db:para: Logs an informational message message in the logging category category. message might contain place holders that are replaced by additional arguments, similar to the C printf() function.
Example:
db:section.db:programlisting: QLoggingCategory category("driver.usb"); qCInfo(category, "an informational message logged into category %s", category.categoryName());

db:note.db:para: Arguments might not be processed if debug output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] qCWarning(category)
db:section.db:para: Returns an output stream for warning messages in the logging category category.
The macro expands to code that checks whether QLoggingCategory::isWarningEnabled() evaluates to true. If so, the stream arguments are processed and sent to the message handler.
Example:

db:note.db:para: Arguments are not processed if warning output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] qCWarning(category, const char *message, ...)
db:section.db:para: Logs a warning message message in the logging category category. message might contain place holders that are replaced by additional arguments, similar to the C printf() function.
Example:
db:section.db:programlisting: QLoggingCategory category("driver.usb"); qCWarning(category, "a warning message logged into category %s", category.categoryName());

db:note.db:para: Arguments might not be processed if warning output for the category is not enabled, so do not rely on any side effects.

db:section.db:para: This macro was introduced in Qt 5.3.
